snippet: Mohammed Wali Zazi, whose son planned to set off bombs on the New York City subway, received four and a half years in prison for obstructing justice.
abstract: Mohammed Wali Zazi, whose son Najibullah Zazi plotted to set off bombs in the New York City subway system, receives four and a half years in prison for obstructing justice by trying to block a federal investigation of his son; Federal District Court Judge John Gleeson rejects prosecution arguments that the lies were themselves crimes of terrorism, which carry a 30-year sentence.
lead_paragraph: Mohammed Wali Zazi, whose son planned to set off bombs on the New York City subway, received four and a half years in prison for obstructing justice.

headline.seo: Mohammed Wali Zazi Sentenced for Lying About Subway Bomb Plot
headline.main: Prison for Father Who Lied About Terror Plot
headline.print_headline: Prison for Father Who Lied About Terror Plot
